newsitem.title: UKRAINE: SOCCER-UKRAINE EYE TOP SPOT WITH VICTORY OVER NORTHERN IRISH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-UKRAINE EYE TOP SPOT WITH VICTORY OVER NORTHERN IRISH.

text.p: Ukraine will take over the lead in World Cup qualifying group nine if they beat Northern Ireland on Wednesday -- while victory will bring the Irish level on points with Ukraine and Portugal.

But all three nations in the tightly-contested group know that the matches they still have to play against European champions Germany in the second half of the qualifying campaign will have a huge impact on their chances of reaching the finals in France next year.

Portugal, who drew 0-0 with Northern Ireland in Belfast on Saturday, currently lead the group with nine points, although they have played two matches more than Ukraine, who beat Albania 1-0 in neutral Spain on Saturday. They trail the Portuguese because of a slightly inferior goal difference.
Ukraine defeated the Irish 1-0 in Belfast in August and another victory for the home side would just about put the Irish out of the picture.
But a victory over Ukraine would keep Northern Ireland very much involved in the hunt.

Ukraine are expecting to field the side that beat Albania and are hoping for a big crowd, boosted by low ticket prices of about $3. The president of Ukraine's soccer federation, Valery Pustovoitenko, has urged Ukrainians to come to the 100,000-seat stadium and back the national team.

Although Northern Ireland's home form has been disappointing with only one win in their four games in Belfast, they did hold Germany to a 1-1 draw on their travels in November, and could easily emerge unscathed from their visit to Kiev.
Northern Ireland boss Bryan Hamilton will be able to call up both Michael Hughes and Kevin Horlock for the match.

They were both suspended for the game against Portugal and he is pleased that none of the five players on yellow cards -- Colin Hill, skipper Iain Dowie, Tommy Wright, Steve Lomas or Keith Gillespie -- picked up another booking.

Ukraine: Oleg Suslov; Mikhail Starostyak, Serguei Bejenar, Alexandr Golovko, Vladislav Vachtchuk, Dmitro Myhaiylenko, Gennadiy Orbu, Youri Kalitvintsev, Vitali Kossovskii, Andriy Shevchenko, Serguei Rebrov.
Northern Ireland (probable): Tommy Wright; Colin Hill, Stephen Morrow, Gerry Taggart, Ian Nolan; Stephen Lomas, Neil Lennon, Jim Magilton; Iain Dowie, Keith Gillespie, Michael Hughes.
